classes.name: MessageDigest
classes.description: Provides the functionality of a message digest algorithm such as SHA-256 or MD5. Used in Ignition scripts for hashing passwords, verifying data integrity, and generating checksums.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The name of the algorithm requested (e.g., "SHA-256", "MD5", "SHA-1", "SHA-512")

returns.description: A MessageDigest object implementing the specified algorithm

methods.description: Returns a MessageDigest object that implements the specified digest algorithm. Common algorithms: MD5, SHA-1, SHA-256, SHA-384, SHA-512.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The name of the algorithm requested

params.name: provider
params.description: The name of the provider (e.g., "SUN")

returns.description: A MessageDigest object implementing the specified algorithm from the specified provider

methods.description: Returns a MessageDigest object that implements the specified digest algorithm from the specified provider.

methods.name: isEqual

params.name: digesta
params.description: One of the digests to compare

params.name: digestb
params.description: The other digest to compare

returns.description: True if the two digests are equal, false otherwise

methods.description: Compares two digests for equality. Does a simple byte comparison. Uses a constant-time comparison to prevent timing attacks.

methods.name: update

params.name: input
params.description: The byte with which to update the digest

methods.description: Updates the digest using the specified byte.

methods.name: update

params.name: input
params.description: The array of bytes with which to update the digest

methods.description: Updates the digest using the specified array of bytes.

methods.name: update

params.name: input
params.description: The array of bytes

params.name: offset
params.description: The offset to start from in the array of bytes

params.name: len
params.description: The number of bytes to use, starting at offset

methods.description: Updates the digest using the specified subarray of bytes, starting at the specified offset.

methods.name: digest

returns.description: The array of bytes for the resulting hash value

methods.description: Completes the hash computation by performing final operations such as padding. The digest is reset after this call is made.

methods.name: digest

params.name: input
params.description: The input to be updated before the digest is completed

returns.description: The array of bytes for the resulting hash value

methods.description: Performs a final update on the digest using the specified array of bytes, then completes the digest computation.

methods.name: reset
methods.description: Resets the digest for further use.

methods.name: getAlgorithm

returns.description: The name of the algorithm (e.g., "SHA-256")

methods.description: Returns a string that identifies the algorithm, independent of implementation details.

methods.name: getDigestLength

returns.description: The digest length in bytes, or 0 if the operation is not supported

methods.description: Returns the length of the digest in bytes, or 0 if this operation is not supported by the provider.

methods.name: clone

returns.description: A clone of this MessageDigest object

methods.description: Returns a clone if the implementation is cloneable.

classes.name: SecureRandom
classes.description: Provides a cryptographically strong random number generator (RNG). Used in Ignition scripts for generating secure tokens, nonces, and random values where predictability must be avoided.

constructors.description: Constructs a new SecureRandom using the default random number algorithm.

params.name: seed
params.description: The seed bytes

constructors.description: Constructs a new SecureRandom using the specified seed bytes.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The name of the RNG algorithm (e.g., "SHA1PRNG", "NativePRNG")

returns.description: A SecureRandom object implementing the specified algorithm

methods.description: Returns a SecureRandom object that implements the specified random number generator algorithm.

methods.name: getInstanceStrong

returns.description: A strong SecureRandom instance as indicated by the securerandom.strongAlgorithms Security property

methods.description: Returns a SecureRandom object that was selected using the algorithms/providers specified in the securerandom.strongAlgorithms Security property.

methods.name: getSeed

params.name: numBytes
params.description: The number of seed bytes to generate

returns.description: The seed bytes

methods.description: Returns the given number of seed bytes, computed using the seed generation algorithm that this class uses to seed itself.

methods.name: nextBytes

params.name: bytes
params.description: The byte array to fill with random bytes

methods.description: Generates a user-specified number of random bytes and places them into the supplied byte array.

methods.name: nextInt

returns.description: A random int value

methods.description: Returns the next pseudorandom, uniformly distributed int value from this random number generator's sequence.

methods.name: nextInt

params.name: bound
params.description: The upper bound (exclusive), must be positive

returns.description: A random int value between 0 (inclusive) and bound (exclusive)

methods.description: Returns a pseudorandom, uniformly distributed int value between 0 (inclusive) and the specified value (exclusive).

methods.name: nextLong

returns.description: A random long value

methods.description: Returns the next pseudorandom, uniformly distributed long value from this random number generator's sequence.

methods.name: nextDouble

returns.description: A random double value between 0.0 (inclusive) and 1.0 (exclusive)

methods.description: Returns the next pseudorandom, uniformly distributed double value between 0.0 and 1.0 from this random number generator's sequence.

methods.name: nextBoolean

returns.description: A random boolean value

methods.description: Returns the next pseudorandom, uniformly distributed boolean value from this random number generator's sequence.

methods.name: nextFloat

returns.description: A random float value between 0.0 (inclusive) and 1.0 (exclusive)

methods.description: Returns the next pseudorandom, uniformly distributed float value between 0.0 and 1.0 from this random number generator's sequence.

methods.name: nextGaussian

returns.description: A random double value with Gaussian distribution, mean 0.0 and standard deviation 1.0

methods.description: Returns the next pseudorandom, Gaussian distributed double value with mean 0.0 and standard deviation 1.0 from this random number generator's sequence.

methods.name: setSeed

params.name: seed
params.description: The seed value

methods.description: Reseeds this random object using the given long seed. The given seed supplements, rather than replaces, the existing seed.

methods.name: setSeed

params.name: seed
params.description: The seed bytes

methods.description: Reseeds this random object using the given seed bytes. The given seed supplements, rather than replaces, the existing seed.

methods.name: generateSeed

params.name: numBytes
params.description: The number of seed bytes to generate

returns.description: The seed bytes

methods.description: Returns the given number of seed bytes, computed using the seed generation algorithm that this class uses to seed itself.

methods.name: getAlgorithm

returns.description: The name of the algorithm

methods.description: Returns the name of the algorithm implemented by this SecureRandom object.

classes.name: KeyStore
classes.description: Represents a storage facility for cryptographic keys and certificates. Used in Ignition for managing SSL/TLS certificates, trusted CA certificates, and private keys for secure communications.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: type
params.description: The type of keystore (e.g., "JKS", "PKCS12", "JCEKS")

returns.description: A KeyStore object of the specified type

methods.description: Returns a KeyStore object of the specified type. Common types: JKS (Java KeyStore), PKCS12, JCEKS.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: type
params.description: The type of keystore

params.name: provider
params.description: The name of the provider

returns.description: A KeyStore object of the specified type from the specified provider

methods.description: Returns a KeyStore object of the specified type from the specified provider.

methods.name: getDefaultType

returns.description: The default keystore type as specified by the keystore.type security property, or "jks" if no such property exists

methods.description: Returns the default keystore type as specified by the keystore.type security property, or the string "jks" if no such property exists.

methods.name: load

params.name: stream
params.description: The input stream from which the keystore is loaded, or null for an empty keystore

params.name: password
params.description: The password used to check the integrity of the keystore, or null

methods.description: Loads this KeyStore from the given input stream. A password may be given to unlock the keystore (e.g., the keystore resides on a hardware token device) or to check the integrity of the keystore data.

methods.name: store

params.name: stream
params.description: The output stream to which this keystore is written

params.name: password
params.description: The password to generate the keystore integrity check

methods.description: Stores this keystore to the given output stream, and protects its integrity with the given password.

methods.name: getKey

params.name: alias
params.description: The alias name

params.name: password
params.description: The password for recovering the key

returns.description: The requested key, or null if the given alias does not exist or does not identify a key-related entry

methods.description: Returns the key associated with the given alias, using the given password to recover it.

methods.name: getCertificate

params.name: alias
params.description: The alias name

returns.description: The certificate, or null if the given alias does not exist or does not contain a certificate

methods.description: Returns the certificate associated with the given alias. If the given alias identifies a trusted certificate entry, the certificate associated with that entry is returned. If the given alias identifies a key entry, the first element of the certificate chain is returned.

methods.name: getCertificateChain

params.name: alias
params.description: The alias name

returns.description: The certificate chain (ordered from the entity cert to the root CA), or null if the alias does not exist or does not contain a certificate chain

methods.description: Returns the certificate chain associated with the given alias. The certificate chain must have been associated with the alias by a call to setKeyEntry.

methods.name: setKeyEntry

params.name: alias
params.description: The alias name

params.name: key
params.description: The key to be associated with the alias

params.name: password
params.description: The password to protect the key

params.name: chain
params.description: The certificate chain for the corresponding public key (only required if the key is of type PrivateKey)

methods.description: Assigns the given key to the given alias, protecting it with the given password. If the given alias already exists, the keystore information associated with it is overridden.

methods.name: setCertificateEntry

params.name: alias
params.description: The alias name

params.name: cert
params.description: The certificate

methods.description: Assigns the given trusted certificate to the given alias. If the given alias already exists, the keystore information associated with it is overridden.

methods.name: deleteEntry

params.name: alias
params.description: The alias name

methods.description: Deletes the entry identified by the given alias from this keystore.

methods.name: containsAlias

params.name: alias
params.description: The alias name

returns.description: True if this keystore contains an entry for the specified alias, false otherwise

methods.description: Checks if the given alias exists in this keystore.

methods.name: size

returns.description: The number of entries in this keystore

methods.description: Retrieves the number of entries in this keystore.

methods.name: aliases

returns.description: An enumeration of the alias names in this keystore

methods.description: Lists all the alias names of this keystore.

methods.name: isKeyEntry

params.name: alias
params.description: The alias for the keystore entry to be checked

returns.description: True if the entry identified by the given alias is a key-related entry, false otherwise

methods.description: Returns true if the entry identified by the given alias was created by a call to setKeyEntry.

methods.name: isCertificateEntry

params.name: alias
params.description: The alias for the keystore entry to be checked

returns.description: True if the entry identified by the given alias is a trusted certificate entry, false otherwise

methods.description: Returns true if the entry identified by the given alias was created by a call to setCertificateEntry.

methods.name: getType

returns.description: The type of this keystore

methods.description: Returns the type of this keystore.

classes.name: KeyPairGenerator
classes.description: Generates pairs of public and private keys for asymmetric cryptography algorithms such as RSA, DSA, and EC. Used in Ignition for generating key pairs for digital signatures and encryption.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The standard string name of the algorithm (e.g., "RSA", "DSA", "EC")

returns.description: A KeyPairGenerator object that generates public/private key pairs for the specified algorithm

methods.description: Returns a KeyPairGenerator object that generates public/private key pairs for the specified algorithm.

methods.name: initialize

params.name: keysize
params.description: The keysize in bits (e.g., 1024, 2048, 4096 for RSA)

methods.description: Initializes the key pair generator for a certain keysize using a default source of randomness.

methods.name: initialize

params.name: keysize
params.description: The keysize in bits

params.name: random
params.description: The source of randomness

methods.description: Initializes the key pair generator for a certain keysize with the given source of randomness.

methods.name: generateKeyPair

returns.description: The generated key pair

methods.description: Generates a key pair. If this KeyPairGenerator has not been initialized explicitly, provider-specific defaults will be used for the size and other values of the generated keys.

methods.name: genKeyPair

returns.description: The generated key pair

methods.description: Generates a key pair. This is a convenience method, equivalent to generateKeyPair().

methods.name: getAlgorithm

returns.description: The standard string name of the algorithm

methods.description: Returns the standard name of the algorithm for this key pair generator.

classes.name: Signature
classes.description: Provides the functionality of a digital signature algorithm such as SHA256withRSA or SHA1withDSA. Used in Ignition for signing data to ensure authenticity and integrity, and for verifying digital signatures.

methods.name: getInstance

params.name: algorithm
params.description: The standard name of the algorithm (e.g., "SHA256withRSA", "SHA1withDSA", "SHA256withECDSA")

returns.description: A Signature object implementing the specified algorithm

methods.description: Returns a Signature object that implements the specified signature algorithm.

methods.name: initSign

params.name: privateKey
params.description: The private key of the identity whose signature is going to be generated

methods.description: Initializes this object for signing. If this method is called again with a different argument, it negates the effect of this call.

methods.name: initVerify

params.name: publicKey
params.description: The public key of the identity whose signature is going to be verified

methods.description: Initializes this object for verification. If this method is called again with a different argument, it negates the effect of this call.

methods.name: update

params.name: data
params.description: The array of bytes to use for the update

methods.description: Updates the data to be signed or verified, using the specified array of bytes.

methods.name: update

params.name: data
params.description: The array of bytes

params.name: off
params.description: The offset to start from in the array of bytes

params.name: len
params.description: The number of bytes to use, starting at offset

methods.description: Updates the data to be signed or verified, using the specified subarray of bytes.

methods.name: sign

returns.description: The signature bytes of the signing operation's result

methods.description: Returns the signature bytes of all the data updated. The signature is reset after this call and the object can be reused to generate further signatures.

methods.name: verify

params.name: signature
params.description: The signature bytes to be verified

returns.description: True if the signature was verified, false if not

methods.description: Verifies the passed-in signature. The signature is reset after this call and the object can be reused to verify further signatures.

methods.name: getAlgorithm

returns.description: The name of the algorithm for this Signature object

methods.description: Returns the name of the algorithm for this signature object.
